meanings.definition: An expression of disgust or aversion.
meanings.sent2: She said 'yuk' when she saw the slimy bug.
meanings.sent3: Yuk! I accidentally stepped in a puddle of mud.
meanings.sent4: The smell was so bad, it made me say 'yuk' out loud.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the medicine was a big 'yuk' for the child.

meanings.definition: To laugh or joke in a silly or playful manner.
meanings.sent1: Let's yuk it up at the comedy show tonight!
meanings.sent2: The children always yuk around during recess.
meanings.sent3: They love to yuk and giggle at each other's jokes.
meanings.sent4: The friends would yuk it up until their stomachs hurt.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's jokes never fail to make the audience yuk with laughter.
